title: Album Page, "Plan and Elevation, Pulpit at Torcello", October 27, 1887
medium: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 76 / 87.  Below this: molding on desk; to right of elevation drawing: white and blue... / pillar is pink, white base / the center panel is / light house green with / yellow caused by fungus growth / green yellow et [sic] brown.  Above the small molding drawn at right: ... braid bead leaf bead center sculpture; in the margin below, at right: 1604 / by bill 1740.  To right of plan drawing: (written perpendicular to drawing) plan front; Pulpit at Torcello / Oct 27th 1887 / this is the pulpit on which Ruskin gives a long sermon.
description: Vertical sheet depicting a colonnaded structure with a small recessed opening visible. A carved panel and elaborately carved moldings have been sketched in the center section.  Various details have also been given letter designations which correspond to their color, which is sometimes noted in the margin to the left of this drawing.  Below is a view in plan of a circular structure with columnar supports visible.  There is another small drawing of a molding detail at center right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Plan and Elevation, Pulpit at Torcello", October 27, 1887.
October 27, 1887. Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-147.
